verses.verse: Then the high priest said, "Are these things so?"

He [Stephen] said, "Men, brothers, and fathers, listen. The God of glory appeared to our father Abraham when he was in Mesopotamia before he lived in Haran, Act 7:3 and said to him, «Get out of your country and from your kinfolk and come to the land that I show you.»
"So he left the land of the Chaldeans and lived in Haran. From there, after his father had died, he moved him into this land where you now live.

"He gave him no inheritance in it, no, not even enough to set his foot on, yet he promised that he would give it to him as a possession and to his descendants after him even though he still had no child.
"God said it in this way so that his descendants would live in a foreign land and that they would be brought into bondage and vexed for 400 years.
"The nation to whom they would be vexed by, «I will punish,» God said, «and after that they will come out of there and serve me in this place.»
"He gave him the covenant of circumcision, then he fathered Isaac and circumcised him on the eighth day, and Isaac fathered Jacob, and Jacob fathered the twelve Patriarchs.
"The Patriarchs motivated by envy, sold Joseph into Egypt, but God was with him,
delivered him out of all his afflictions, and gave him favor and wisdom in Pharaoh's, king of Egypt's, eyes. He made him governor over Egypt and all his house.
"Then a famine passed over all the land of Egypt and Haran [causing] great affliction, for our fathers found no food.
"When Jacob heard that there was grain in Egypt, he sent our fathers first,
and the second time Joseph made himself known to his brothers, and Joseph's kinfolk was made known to Pharaoh.
"Then Joseph sent and called for his father, Jacob, to [come] to him as well as all his kinfolk--a total of 75 souls.
"So Jacob went down to Egypt and died as did our fathers
then they crossed over to Shechem and were laid in the tomb that Abraham bought for a sum of money from the sons of Emmor, the [father] of Shechem.
"When the time for the promise drew close--that God had sworn to Abraham--the number of the people grew rapidly in Egypt,
until another king arose who didn't know Joseph.
"He dealt deceitfully with our countrymen and treated our fathers badly, so that they threw out their young children, so they wouldn't live.
"At this time Moses was born; he was a very lovely child reared at his father's house for three months.
"After he was put out, Pharaoh's daughter took him up and reared him as her own son.
"So Moses was educated in all the learning of the Egyptians and was mighty in words and deeds.
"When he was a full forty years old, it came into his heart to visit his brethren, the children of Israel.
"Seeing one of them suffer, he defended [him], avenged him who was harassed and fatally hit the Egyptian.
"He supposed his brethren would have understood how God through him would deliver them, but they didn't understand.
"The next day, he again showed himself as they were arguing and was trying to reconcile them saying, «Sirs, you are brethren; why do this wrong thing to each other?»
"But he who was doing the wrong to his neighbor pushed him away saying, «Who made you a ruler and judge over us?
Are you going to kill me, like you did the Egyptian yesterday?»
"Then Moses fled at this saying and was a foreigner in the land of Midian where he fathered two sons.
"After [another] forty years had gone by, an angel of the Lord appeared to him in a flame of fire of a bush in the wilderness of Mount Sinai.
"When Moses saw [this], he wondered at this vision, and as he drew near to look, the Lord's voice came to him,
saying, «I am the God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.» Then Moses started shaking and didn't dare look.
"Then the Lord said to him, «Take off your shoes from your feet, for the place where you are standing is holy ground.
I truly have seen the affliction of my people, which are in Egypt, and I have heard their groaning. I have come down to deliver them. Now, come here; I will send you to Egypt.»
"This Moses whom they rejected saying, «Who made you to be a ruler and judge?» This one God did sent to be a ruler and deliverer by the hand of the angel which appeared to him at the bush.
"He brought them out, after he had showed them wonders and signs in the land of Egypt, the Red sea, and for forty years in the wilderness.
"This is that Moses who said to the children of Israel, «A prophet will the Lord your God raise up for you from your brethren like me; you must listen to him.»
"This is he who was in the congregation in the wilderness with the angel, who spoke to him at mount Sinai and our fathers; he received the living words to give to us.
"To whom our fathers would not obey but pushed him away from them and in their hearts turned back to Egypt
telling Aaron, «Make us gods to go before us, as for this Moses who brought us our of the land of Egypt, we don't know what has happened to him.»
"They made a calf at that time and offered sacrifices to this idol and rejoiced in the works of their own hands.

"So God turned and gave them up to worship the host of heaven just like it is written in the book of the prophets, «O house of Israel, have you offered to me killed animals and sacrifices for forty years in the wilderness?
Yes, you took up the tabernacle of Moloch and the star of your god, Remphan, objects which you made to worship, so I will carry you away beyond Babylon.»
"Our fathers had the tabernacle of witness in the wilderness, just as he had told him to, telling Moses that he should make it just like the one he had seen.
"Our fathers, which came afterward, were brought by Joshua into the possession of the gentiles whom God drove out before the presence of our fathers up to the days of David,
who found favor before God and asked to find a tabernacle for the God of Jacob,
but Solomon built the house to him.
"Nonetheless the most High doesn't live in temples made by hands as the prophet says,
«Heaven is my throne and earth is my footstool, so what kind of house will you build for me,» says the Lord, «or where is the place for me to rest?
Hasn't my hand made all these things?»
"You stiff necked and uncircumcised in heart and ears; you always resist the Holy Spirit. As your fathers did, so do you.
"Which of the prophets didn't your fathers persecute? They have killed those who told about the coming of the Just One, whom you have now betrayed and killed.
"You who have received the law delivered by angels and have not obeyed it."
After they heard these things, they were enraged deeply into their hearts and gnashed their teeth at him.
But he, full of the Holy Spirit, looked up steadily into heaven and saw the glory of God and Jesus standing at the right hand of God.
He said, "Look, I see the heavens open and the Son of Man standing at the right hand of God."
Then they cried out with a loud voice, stopped their ears, and all rushed at him together.
They threw him out of the city and stoned him; the witnesses laid down their garments at a young man named Saul.
They stoned Stephen, who was calling out to God and saying, "Lord Jesus received my spirit."
He fell down and shouted with a loud voice, "Lord, do not hold this sin against them." After saying that he fell asleep.
